text:
this should be easy. the servlet uses a little of xerces.jar (tried both 1.4.0 
and 1.4.2) and dom.jar for some very simple xml parsing on tomcat 3.2.2 on BSD 
unix which yields the following two errors:

java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: Unimplemented interface method at 
org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.setDocumentClassName (DOMParser.java:504)

and occassionally:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/xerces/dom/DocumentImpl at 
org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.setDocumentClassName (DOMParser.java:504)

might the classes in tomcat's parser.jar be in contention with xerces.jar 
and/or dom.jar?
we've installed/restarted, etc. by the book.
is there a quick fix?

looks like I'm going to have to write my own parser without the overhead.
creator: johnp@knorrinteractive.com
johnp@knorrinteractive.com
text:
developed and tested ok with forte4j on win2000, it's internal tomcat and java 
1.3.1. copied over the same xerces.jar and dom.jar (even tried java 1.1.8)

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Fixed in 3.3.
Workaround for 3.2: replace jaxp.jar, crimson.jar with xerces.jar, in lib.
